comment: Did this over Summer so it was compacted into 8 weeks. He was clear from day 1 that he grades very liberally and will not allow make up work. Lectures and PP are loaded regularly. He drops low grades and allows a retest at the end of the semester. No lockdown browser or cameras. Easiest A so far. I will try and take more of his classes....

Attendance is not mandatory, he posts the lectures an powerpoints online. Grades consisted mainly of quizzes and exams. The grading is weighted, either 75% Final Exam/25% Quizzes-Midterm OR vice versa. Quizzes/Exams are based off of the PPs, gives enough time. Only thing to look out for, he ends quiz/exams at times like 12pm, not 11:59pm.

Each class is a lecture that you can access via Teams at home if you don't want to physically go to class. Notes are posted after each class, but I found the lectures helpful. No lockdown browser or outrageous timers on quizzes and exams. Great guy just pretty sure he is at KSU for research or something else besides just teaching.

On the first day of class, he told us he was not going to take time out of his day to learn who we are, so that rubbed me the wrong way. His work was easy, and all his tests were online including the final and did not require lockdown browser. Attendance is never required. He lectures his whole class.

I took Professor Bradbury over the summer for microeconomics. He was truly caring and respectful, he emailed back incredibly quickly, and the lectures were never boring. I truly learned a lot in this class,  I would highly recommend taking him.

The professor has a clear syllabus that he lives by faithfully. I would suggest that if you have a question about the class, please read the syllabus first. The class was not hard but you should definitely read the chapters for sure. You will have quizzes and tests mostly. He does respond to emails.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor, makes sure that his students have the resources to succeed, records lectures live if you miss, weekly quizzes and 3 tests, he goes over the content and everything you need to know. Lectures can feel long but he tries to add modern references to keep us engaged. Does grade replacement. Don't buy book. Low stress class environment.

Amazing professor. Has a very lenient grading scale and attendance is not mandatory but that should not stop you from going to his lectures, he is incredibly smart, engaging, and funny. I genuinely looked forward to going to class each day. You will be grateful you chose him as your professor

Professor Bradbury is a great Professor! Attendance isn't mandatory so many people don't go to class. His grades consist of weekly quizzes, three tests, and a final exam. They are all taken online with no lockdown browser.

Very online-accessible, all quizzes and exams were online and lectures were re-uploaded on D2L for our convenience. Very quippy, but solid & informative powerpoints and clear about his grading policies. Does not inject his own opinion on things very often, sticks to the material without being dry despite dry subject matter. Overall good choice!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I had this professor for Fall of 2023 and he was great! His test/quizzes questions are exactly what he went over in class, as well as his lecture power points. Though participation is not required, I would go to his lectures because he explains concepts very well and he's honestly entertaining. Make sure to not miss any tests!

Very accessible lectures and very lenient grading scale (no extra credit because of that). He's a pretty decent professor, he puts video recordings and Zoom meetings live from the classroom. Quizzes are decently difficult, but you should be alright. Come to class with questions, he's always willing to answer any you've got.

The quizzes/tests can be kind of difficult. He acknowledges that they are kind of difficult, so he has a very generous grading scale. He puts his lectures on zoom, so that is a plus. He is a good teacher, but the lectures can be kind of long and boring.
Great professor with a very lenient grading system. Highly would recommend him. I got a B in the class but that is attributed to my PERSONAL lack of care, not the professor.

VERY generous grading scale. Attendance is optional because he records his lectures on Zoom and uploads them within 24 hours of the class letting out. Weekly quizzes based on that week's lectures, all open note and open book. Not a hard class to pass if you at least try to watch the zoom meetings in lieu of going to class

I took him for the fall 2022 semester and it was great. Your only grades are weekly quizzes, 3 midterms, and the final, but they're all online and don't use the Lockdown browser, so they're basically open book. While I recommend going to class, he does record class via Zoom and posts the lecture slides weekly. Textbook is not necessary whatsoever.

I was under the impression that this class would be easy but it caused me more stress than I wouldve ever thought. He makes this class seem easy then gives quizzes and exams that a majority of the class do poorly on. I barely made an A. however, there were also many drops and a replacement quiz.

Mandatory attendance I think for me was a need cause every Wednesday he would release all of the PowerPoints/lecture notes, but sometimes there would be questions on the weekly quizzes that he had explained or said in the in-person class. he does record all of the classes and there is also a live Zoom meeting for each lecture if u miss a class.

Easiest class of my life. I took it as an 8 week summer class and I was able to get it all done in one afternoon a week. That means I only spent a total of 9 days on this class over the course of 8 weeks. Just watch the lectures (which were well done), take notes, take the quiz and/or test for that week, and rinse and repeat the next week.

Weekly quizzes are super easy and he drops a few at the end of the semester. Tests are straight from the lectures. I didn't buy the book and got As on every assignment. He makes lots of sports references. He is openly economically-conservative, if that bothers you.

He always rounds grades up, and there is a 2 point curve on the grades. I did not go to class once and made one point below an A. The tests and quizzes are all online with no proctor or lockdown browser. It is straight out of the powerpoints which are always uploaded online. The only grades are weekly quizzes, two midterms and the final.
He was very nice and I liked his lectures. Content was boring, but thats just an opinion. Everything was online and he recorded every lecture. Posted the lecture notes on D2l.

be warned. he will NEVER let you make up a grade if you miss a test or quiz. even if you have a good excuse, since the testing window is open for three days he refuses to honor even a 504, but for SOME REASON he will open the testing window an extra two days because there's a baseball game. but easy A as long as you don't miss a test or quiz.

I hate economics, but he made it fun enough. There were 3 exams, and that's it. The tests are multiple choice and so easy. If you take honors, you have to draw a couple graphs that are also pretty easy and he covers them in class thoroughly. There are extra credit questions as well. An A was an 85+.

Professor is a pretty cool person. This is a very easy class; you have 1 open notes quiz every week. However, there are some specific examples that you should pay attention to in his lectures that appear on quizzes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Took this as an 8-week summer course. Extremely easy class. Only graded on quizzes and tests and the content is pretty easy. There were a few questions that stemmed from the textbook, but most could be answered using info from the lecture vids. No lockdown for quizzes or tests. Was a bit disappointed that he recycled lectures from a few years ago.

I took ECON 1000 with Dr. Bradbury over the summer, so the course was entirely online. It was very easy, and the lectures were very easy to follow. It wasn't too much work either. Just watch the lectures and take the quizzes and tests. Also, everything was open-note, without lockdown browser, which was very helpful.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him for honors and loved his sense of humor. There were only 3 exams, no homework, and some study guides to practice on your own time. Covid made it online. Posted all his lectures and notes. If you wanna succeed make sure you know the concepts and def watch the lectures. He's more than happy to answer questions. Great and kind personality.

Professor Bradbury is an amazing professor. I took the honors version of this class. He records his lecture ahead of time for students to watch at their own pace, and during scheduled class time he allows students to ask questions. He explains the material very well and draws a lot of graphs. He goes over the tests and explains all of the answers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took prof Bradbury almost all online, but he presented the material so well. He would post a lecture, along with his lecture notes, which were very helpful. Then he had an optional Zoom meeting for any questions. Only graded on 3 tests, but they were not hard, and come mostly down to common sense. He is a great guy and I would def take him again.

He only grades tests for the gradebook and provides recorded lectures and notes. He's very sweet and passionate about the class and is quite accessible outside of class. We had a textbook but I never read from it, only the powerpoints and did super well. His video meetings were mostly Q&A vs lecture. You usually study on your own time
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is the best professor at KSU. He does only have 3 tests and that is yet nothing else, but he understands his class is hard, so he always curves the tests. He really is a great guy and he is so into what he is teaching, and is one you will always remember

His lectures are awesome. He explains everything and says that anything you need to know will be explained in class (i.e. textbooks aren't needed). He's available for meetings if you need extra help and answers emails quickly. This is the 2nd class I've taken with him and I almost wish I had more Econ requirements so I can take more classes w/him
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: My favorite professor all semester. Really cares about economics and his lectures were super interesting. As long as you usually attend class his tests are extremely easy. There are only 3 tests for the class and no other grades. He does not require the textbook and agrees they are too expensive which I appreciate. Also just very helpful.

Textbook is unnecessary. His lectures are pretty good and were interesting enough for microecon. He uploads all his notes as PPTs and puts them on D2L. Grading scale is wacky, but an 87.1 is an A. Tests were pretty average, not easy, but not crazy difficult. Going over his notes will help the most.

Professor Bradburys class wasnt hard, but you have to go to class and listen closely to the lectures to do well on the test. His lectures were good and spot on for test material in my opinion, he made things easy to learn and remember.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are good. He really tries to make everyone understand the material. Sometimes he can sidetrack in his stories, but that's normal. He really tries to help everyone do well. He curved all of our tests and he puts out study guides that really help. He doesn't use powerpoint that much, but posts all of his notes. Book is a waste of money

He was a great guy, but his lectures were often times dreadful to sit through, as you would have to decode the important material from his lectures. Uses some power points but does not thoroughly explain his material. If his lectures were less of a dread, i would most likely take him again. Posts all of his notes online, study them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: So the good thing is that the class is graded through a 12 point scale and he weighs in the highest test average to 75% and puts the others to 25%. Besides that, the class is extremely boring, dreadful, and the lectures will make you want to walk out since class is non mandatory. Just try to pay attention even though the lectures don't cover much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Class consisted of lots of lectures and he would often start talking about random stuff a lot of times. There arent very many grade opportunities either.

Professor Bradbury is a good but tough teacher. There are only 2 "midterms" and the final so there aren't many grades. He does grade on a 12 point scale which helps. He uses PP but hardly shows them in class so you need to pay attention to what he is saying. The class was easy but hard at the same time.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Bradbury is super nice and cares about his students. He encourages students to use his office hours if you don't understand something. The class was just lectures and tests which I didn't like. He also barely uses any visuals other than him drawing graphs, so if you have a hard time focusing during lectures this class may not be for you.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: The class is super difficult and you're only graded on three tests, one of them being the final. His lectures are also super boring. Some goods things are that he grades on a 12 point scale so an 88-100 is an "A", 76-87 is a "B", and so on. He also is really nice and helpful when approached and rounds border-line grades.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM. He is not a good teacher. All over the place. He only gives you THREE test that if you fail, you fail class. You may feel you did better but you didnt. He doesnt give anything to get better, only test. If you need extra work or credit, you wont get that. No extra help for grades. Youre stuck!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Only 3 grades the whole semester, 2 midterms and a final. His honors tests are very hard and all short answer.

He's ok. There is absolutely no homework, so there's no way to know if you fully understand the material until you take one of the three tests. If you think you're good enough at econ that you don't need outside practice, go ahead. I need homework and quizzes to gauge my understanding, so this didn't work out, but he really does care about econ.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Bradbury is a solid choice for a basic economics class. He doesn't require the textbook which is amazing. I did good on the exams without the textbook and the exams are all multiple choice. The class is lecture heavy and attendance is not mandatory, as long as you read the notes and practice supply/demand you should be fine. No homework!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is awesome, but only if you show up and take notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: It made it very easy to understand the material.
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY--Amazing lectures--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His lectures are pretty boring. He talks fast and does not use PowerPoints to follow along with. He posts powerpoints of lectures online only after he has already lectured about it. There are only 3 tests and a final. He does use a curve and a 12 point grading scale so an 88-100 is an A. It was my last favorite class.

Anyone who left Bradbury a negative review is just mad bc they received a bad grade. He is a more than fair professor. His tests are only hard if you half a** study so as long as you pay attention and thoroughly study/understand the material you will be fine. He also grades on a twelve point scale which is great. Funny guy as well
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Econ has always been a subject I struggled a lot with but I did extremely well in Dr Bradbury's class. His lectures are organized perfectly for note taking and he keeps them interesting. He posts notes on d2l after each lecture and if you do the study guides you will do well on the test. Definitely recommend taking.

Dr. Bradbury is a solid choice for ECON1000. Attendance not required, but recommended. No homework. Only grades for the class are two midterms and a final. Grading policy: If mean (average) of Midterms  Final Exam: Midterms: 25%, Final Exam: 75% If mean (average) of Midterms > Final Exam: Midterms: 75%, Final Exam: 25% Exams can be a bit hard.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He lectures a lot, but sometimes he lets you out early. His tests are very difficult because of the answer choices he puts on the tests. He will try to trick you on purpose. On positive is that he doesn't teach you using numbers like some econ teachers, you only need to know topics and definitions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He has no notes whats so ever and advises not purchasing the book in the beginning of the semester. So you as the student are left with just the words he says and the internet to help you. He thinks he is above everyone and his study guides only help to get you a C. Hes a horrible professor and I would never recommend him to anyone.

I took AP Econ in high school and made a 103. When I decided to take econ I knew it would be an easy A, but it was not. Finished the class with an 87. Only three tests the first two were only 25 questions so if you missed more than two you make a B. The final was only 33. No homework and he doesn't make you show up but do not take him please.

Wouldn't recommend. only 3 tests, no ec or other assignments. luckily he averages the test 25% of ur 2 best or 75% on the midterm. His tests are tricky, and he gets very defensive when asked questions. Hes funny sometimes, but he isn't a good professor. He makes an entry level class too confusing and difficult. His notes are unclear as well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: There is no homework, assignments, or quizzes in his ECON 1000 class. There are  4 tests and that is it. If you listen carefully and take notes in class, and STUDY before tests,  You should come through alright.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Bradbury is the realest teacher I've had in a while. He does not assign any unnecessary work, but he does want you to succeed. He gives you the material exactly on the test and if you study your notes, you'll do fine. If you do nothing outside of class you will struggle. Funny and helpful.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Bradbury hands down one of the best Econ professors there is. Econ 1000 is pretty much an intro into economics and can be very hard to learn. Yet hes very knowledgeable of the subject  makes the lectures easy and literally gives test straight from the notes we take in class. Econ can get confusing at times but he does a amazing job making it simple

3 tests. Mercy on the final. Wow it was a hard class. Good dude, but I suggest looking elsewhere. Tests were extremely difficult. He gives a curve on tests, but sometimes even thats not enough. You think you get the material, then test time comes up and you're screwed. Shouldn't have been this hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I honestly loved this professor at first. Great sense of humor and lectures were enjoyable. However, your grade consists of 3 tests and that's it. He refused to give us any practice problems or study material at LEAST. & gave zero extra credit. I am a straight A student and did awful in his class. Unless you have a grip on Econ. already stay away!!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Overall not a good professor. There were only 2 tests and a final so if you mess one up you're basically screwed. Doesn't post grades online. The entire class is just him lecturing and drawing graphs, no set notes or anything to reference for studying. The tests were pretty hard and had no graphs despite that being all he ever did during lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: 3 exams, no homework or practice, no powerpoints, nothing. Test format consists of multiple choice with no free response, and out of the five possible answers for each question, 2 of them are a combination of the prior 3. It's an impossible way to run an economics class. I wish I would've dropped it. This hurt my GPA when it should've helped.

comment: Overall Dr. Bradbury is a good professor. Very knowledgeable, gives good lectures, and will help you out if you need it. 2 tests and the final are your only grades so be careful. Test material comes from the lectures in class. They aren't terribly hard but not easy. You can use the book to supplement the in class material but it isn't necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Your grade consists of three exams. No homework to practice on your own, no power points. He just stands in front of the class drawing graph after graph then gives the exam which consists of no graphs at all. The class averaged a 50 on the first exam. He claims he's not trying to trick you but then puts "bad breath" as an answer on the exam. AVOID
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I was shocked to see I am the first to rate. People are so quick to give bad ratings to teachers I guess the good ones get skipped. TAKE this professor. He is great! Very personable, quick to help, and easy to follow. If you do your work and read you will do well. He gives you everything you need to succeed AND books are CHEAP and very helpful!
